title: Boris Johnson's mother, Charlotte Johnson Wahl, dies aged 79
description: Charlotte Johnson Wahl died "suddenly and peacefully" in London on Monday, the PM's family says.

title: Canada federal election: A look at the key numbers driving the campaign
description: A visual guide to the big issues in Canada's federal election, from climate to cost of living.

title: The Taliban are back – will al-Qaeda follow?
description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

title: China's Covid-fuelled surfing boom
description: Coronavirus restrictions limiting foreign travel lead to a boom in people riding the waves in China.

title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this week’s elections.

title: Megapod of feeding humpback whales 'so special'
description: More than 100 humpback whales have been filmed feeding off Australia's New South Wales coast.

title: Prince Andrew's lawyer says NY case is baseless and non-viable
description: The Duke of York is being sued in New York over allegations of sexual assault by Virginia Giuffre.

title: Tanya Fear: Missing British actress found safe in LA
description: Tanya Fear was reported missing by friends and family, who said she had not been seen since last week.

title: Climate change: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

title: Schoolboy cyclist outpaces pros on Tour of Britain
description: Xander Graham was watched on live TV as he raced alongside riders on the Tour of Britain near Edinburgh.

title: Emma Raducanu set to earn millions after US Open win
description: Brands will be queuing up to secure sponsorship deals with the teenage tennis star, experts say.

title: UK scraps Covid-19 vaccine deal with French firm Valneva
description: The French firm says the deal was cancelled over allegations of a breach of the agreement, which it denies.

title: Emma Raducanu: US Open champion's mental strength is truly special, says coach
description: Andrew Richardson, the coach who guided Emma Raducanu to her astonishing US Open triumph, says her mental strength is "truly special".

title: Arsenal to face holders Barcelona in Women's Champions League group, Chelsea drawn with Wolfsburg
description: Chelsea face Wolfsburg in the Women's Champions League group stages, with Arsenal in with holders Barcelona.

title: MTV Awards 2021: More sparks fly on red carpet than on stage
description: After a scuffle on the red carpet, the ceremony struggles to generate many big new cultural moments.

title: M25 junctions blocked by Insulate Britain campaigners
description: Police make arrests as climate change protests take place at several locations around the motorway.

title: Britney Spears announces engagement to Sam Asghari
description: The singer, who is fighting a legal battle over her conservatorship, met fiancé Sam Asghari in 2016.

title: Primark says leggings still popular as comfort rules
description: The discount fashion chain says shoppers are still stocking up on cycle shorts and seam-free clothes.

title: Afghanistan: UN seeks millions in international aid
description: It is seeking more than $600m (£434m) in aid following the Taliban takeover last month.

title: Eitan Biran: Italy investigates 'kidnap' of cable car crash survivor
description: Eitan Biran, 6, the only survivor of May's disaster, is taken to Israel by his grandfather.

title: Galleri cancer test: What is it and who can get it?
description: Volunteers are being recruited in England for a blood test able to detect more than 50 types of cancer.

title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

title: Tanya Fear: British actress reported missing in LA
description: Tanya Fear, 31, who has appeared in Doctor Who, has not been seen since last week.

title: Warning on teachers' lack of Holocaust knowledge
description: Many teachers do not know enough about the Holocaust to combat myths and falsehoods, a study suggests.

title: 'I will be fit for Ashes' - Australia captain Paine to have neck surgery
description: Australia Test captain Tim Paine is confident he will be fit for the Ashes despite needing surgery to treat a pinched nerve in his neck.

title: North Korea tests new long-range cruise missile
description: It suggests the country is developing new weapons despite food shortages and an economic crisis.

title: Festivals: Period facilities are needed at live events
description: Menstruating at lives event can be "dehumanising and daunting", festival-goers say.

title: Raducanu: US Open champion celebrated in China for her heritage
description: Many in China have been quick to point out the 18-year-old's half-Chinese heritage.

title: The Papers: PM 'to rip up virus rules' and a gong for Raducanu
description: Boris Johnson's winter plan and calls for an honour for the teenage tennis ace make the front pages.

title: Daniil Medvedev: US Open champion finally celebrates - and says title is anniversary present for his wife
description: Winning his first Grand Slam at the US Open was enough for Daniil Medvedev to finally celebrate - and he pulled out a move from a video game.

title: Richard Osman: Trying to make the world a better place
description: The TV star and author shares his life lessons on regret, ageing and doing good.

title: Jesse Lingard takes control of a Rainbow Six Siege esports team
description: The footballer believes his experiences on the pitch will translate to the online world.
